text: Laurie Stone (born 1946) is an American writer and critic. After many years as a journalist at The Village Voice (1974–1999), she was appointed theater critic for The Nation and critic-at-large on NPR's Fresh Air. Her books include a story collection, My Life as an Animal (Northwestern University Press), an essay collection, Laughing in the Dark (Ecco) and a novel, Starting with Serge (Doubleday). In 1996, Stone won the Nona Balakian Excellence in Reviewing Award from the National Book Critics Circle. ==Education== Stone is a graduate of Barnard College (1968) and holds an MA from Columbia University (1969).
